author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Tomb Raider’ Review: Buried by Absurdity
text: What in the world is Alicia Vikander doing in “Tomb Raider”? Raiding a tomb is one answer. Making lots of money is another, and why shouldn’t an exceptionally gifted actress get the gift of a big payday? It’s not as if she doesn’t give this action adventure her all. As a new incarnation of Lara Croft—an earnest successor to the bemuscled and irony-free Angelina Jolie—she endures terrible punishment while vanquishing vile men in brutal combat. What this Lara does best is leap into voids with desperate abandon, but Ms. Vikander...
